com.raweng.built

Class BuiltACL

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.raweng.built.BuiltACL

  • public class BuiltACL
extends java.lang.Object
    Access Control List (ACL) allows you to control who can access the content of your application. You can grant read and write permissions separately to specific users, to groups of users that belong to roles, or you can grant permissions to "the public" so that, for example, any logged-in user could read a particular object but only a particular set of users could write to that object. To specify an ACL to any user who is not logged into the system ,you can use special user uid, "anonymous". Thus using this uid, you can assign permissions to anonymous users.
    Author:
    built.io. Inc

    • Method Detail

      • getAnonymousReadAccess

        public boolean getAnonymousReadAccess()
        Determines whether the object can be read by regardless to logged permission
        Returns:
        returns true, if anonymous is allowed to read this object else returns false.

        Example :
         boolean isAnonymousRead = aclObject.getAnonymousReadAccess();

      • setAnonymousReadAccess

        public void setAnonymousReadAccess(boolean read)
        Sets whether user are allowed to read this object or not, regardless to logged permission
        Parameters:
        read - boolean value.

        Example :
         //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
 BuiltACL aclObject = builtApplication.acl();

 aclObject.setAnonymousReadAccess(true);

      • getAnonymousWriteAccess

        public boolean getAnonymousWriteAccess()
        Determines whether the object can be write by regardless to logged permission
        Returns:
        returns true, if anonymous is allowed to read this object else returns false.

        Example :

      • setUserReadAccess

        public BuiltACL setUserReadAccess(java.lang.String userUid,
                                  boolean read)
        Sets whether this particular user is allowed to read this object or not
        Parameters:
        userUid - User's uid.
        read - boolean value.
        Returns:
        BuiltACL object, so you can chain this call.

        Example :
         //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
 BuiltACL aclObject = builtApplication.acl();

 aclObject.setUserReadAccess("user_uid", true);

      • getUserReadAccess

        public boolean getUserReadAccess(java.lang.String userUid)
        Determines whether the user is allowed to read the object. Even if this returns false, the user may still be able to read it, if getPublicReadAccess() returns true, or if the user belongs to a role that has read access.
        Parameters:
        userUid - User's uid.
        Returns:
        returns true,if given user uid is allowed to read this object else returns false.

        Example :
         boolean isUserRead = aclObject.getUserReadAccess("user_uid");

      • setUserWriteAccess

        public BuiltACL setUserWriteAccess(java.lang.String userUid,

        Parameters:

        update - boolean value.
        Returns:
        BuiltACL object, so you can chain this call.

 BuiltACL aclObject = builtApplication.acl();

 aclObject.setUserWriteAccess("user_uid", true);

      • getUserWriteAccess

        public boolean getUserWriteAccess(java.lang.String userUid)

        userUid - User's uid.
        Returns:
        returns true,if given user uid is allowed to update this object else returns false.

      • getRoleReadAccess

        public boolean getRoleReadAccess(java.lang.String roleUid)
        Determines whether the user with the given role is allowed to read the object. Even if this returns false, the user may still be able to read it, if getPublicReadAccess() returns true, or if the user belongs to another role that has read access.
        Parameters:
        roleUid - role's uid.
        Returns:
        returns true,if given role uid is allowed to read this object else returns false.

        Example :
         boolean isRoleRead = aclObject.getRoleReadAccess("role_uid");
